11.question: What is the best way to clean a cooker hood?
11.answer: Simply use a soft cloth and a neutral, chlorine-free detergent such asÂ Franke Cooker Hood Cleaner. Thanks to its professional formulation, Franke Kitchen Care cooker hood cleaner effectively eliminates grease deposits and odours from your cooker hood, ensuring perfect cleanliness inside and out. You can purchase this productÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/cooker-hood-cleaner-250-ml).

12.question: What is the purpose of the filters? How often do I need to replace them?

13.answer: A pipe diameter of 150 mm. This diameter is ideal for hoods with an extraction capacity of 300 cubic meters per hour and more. If it is not possible to install such a line, a 120 mm diameter line is recommended. Pipes with smaller diameter have a negative impact on the flow and noise level of the hood. Ducting can be purchased on this portal.

2.answer: Generally you will need to purchase a Siphon I, II or III part plumbing kit (depending on the number of sink bowls) when ordering your sink with your retailer. For more information on Franke Siphon Plumbing KitsÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/expertise/special-features/details-that-make-the-difference.html).

Yes. Any sink that has a 3 1/2â€œÂ waste (90mm) is capable of having a waste disposal unit connected. For Franke ceramic sinks an Extended Flange is available for Continuous Feed models.Â If your sink has an overflow you may need to purchase a WDU Overflow Converter, available from ourÂ [service agents](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/wdu-overflow-connector).
You can view videos on Franke Waste Disposal Units on ourÂ [YouTube/UKFranke](http://www.youtube.com/UKFranke)Â channel.

4.question: How do I clean the overflow?

5.question: How do I apply earthing to a Franke sink?
5.answer: Despite any regulatory enforcement, in common with many sink manufacturers Franke make provision for a mechanical bond to be made to inset sink models. This is often done by utilising one of the cut-out points for the clips along the length of the clip rail. In the case of sliding clips Franke make a hole at the end of the clip rail length where the bond can be accommodated.

7.question: I am thinking of installing an inset stainless steel sink into a solid surface worktop, is there anything I need to consider?

8.answer:
Franke sinks come with a 50 year guarantee against manufacturing defect.Â 
For more information on Franke GuaranteesÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/support/after-sales-service/guarantees-page.html).Â 
To enable us to process a guarantee claim, please ensure you provide us with the following information to avoid any unnecessary delay:
- Full Contact Name, Address and Telephone Number
- Proof of Purchase (please attach to email)
- Photographs showing full product and detail shots showing problem
Please complete the relevant form with this informationÂ [here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/ks/support/customer-service.html).

9.question: Should I use a plastic washing up bowl with my Franke sink?

12.answer: No. Stainless Steel will always scratch (whether it be of Franke's manufacture or competitor) and because of the directional polishing marks on many Franke models the scratching will show up quite dramatically initially. However, with use and cleaning using a proprietary cleaner such asÂ Franke Stainless Steel CleanerÂ which you can purchaseÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/stainless-steel-sink-cleaner-200-ml)) the stainless steel will eventually build up a patina over the years and the scratching marks will not be as evident. For more information on cleaning Stainless Steel sinks pleaseÂ [click here](https://www.franke.com/gb/en/hs/expertise/how-to-clean-kitchen-sink.html).

14.question: How can I remove 'rust spots' from my new stainless steel sink?

15.question: How do I best clean my Stainless Steel sink?

16.answer: As a general guide, cut inside the overall frame dimension (by inverting the sink on the worktop) by 8mm all round and always use a 20mm (important!) radius at the corners. Cut out sizes are shown on the specification sheet for each sink. If a template is provided, please use that.
16.question: How do I find out what cut-out dimensions are necessary for my Franke stainless steel sink?

20.question: How do I knock out a taphole in a Fragranite inset sink?
20.answer:
OPTION 1
If you have a coloured dot on the front face of the sink, knock out the taphole as follows:Â 
- Ensure colour sticker is in centre of pre-formed taphole.
- Take sink out of box and rest the sink vertically against your legs with the face of the sink facing outwards and ensuring the taphole is for the correct hand drainer (take care not to damage the edge of the sink in the process).
- Take a centre punch and place on the centre of the colour sticker.
- Strike the punch hard with a hammer - this will result in the core of the tap hole being knocked out.
- Finish off using the ball of the hammer and using a round file.
OPTION 2
If there is NO coloured dot on the front face of the sink, use the hole drill bit provided (FUNÂ 112.0473.656) which is stuck to the back of the drainer next to the sink bowl. Drill out the taphole FROM THE BACK OF THE SINK.

21.answer: For day-to-day care, all you need is water and a damp cloth such as aÂ Franke Microfiber Cloth. A fast and easy way to remove water marks, grease or soap scum deposits, is withÂ Franke Coloured Sink Cleaner, or with a proprietary bathroom cleaner such as Ajax or Flash liquid spray, or similar products found in your supermarket. Franke cleaning products can be purchased [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair).

22.answer:
Only drill Tap hole FROM TOP FACE
1\. Decide on the pre- punched tap holes you require.
2\. Measure to find the centre of the pre- punched tap hole required and cover the area with masking tape.
3\. Using a centre punch, crack the glaze in the centre of the required hole.
4\. Using a No. 8 masonry drill, carefully drill a small pilot hole from the top. NB. Only drill one small hole
5\. You can then proceed to enlarge the hole to the required size by carefully using your hammer with the centrepunch.

14.answer: We advise you to clean your hob when the surface is still warm and the residual heat indicator lamps are off. Firstly, use a scraper to remove any food residue, taking care not to scratch the surface of the glass; then rinse with water and dry well with a clean cloth. We then recommend the use ofÂ Franke Hob CleanerÂ which can be purchasedÂ [here](https://www.central-servicesuk.co.uk/new/care-and-repair/hob-cleaner-250-ml), this product effectively removes dirt and burnt-on food from your hob, ensuring thorough cleanliness and care.
14.question: What is the best way to clean the surface of an induction hob?

17.answer: It is normal for the hob to produce humming sounds when boiling or cooking. Different types of cookware may produce slight sounds such as buzzes or hums. Lighter weight stainless steel pans produce more noise than heavier pans, like enameled cast iron.

1.answer: Modern kitchen taps, regardless of material and design, will last a very long time if properly cared for. Do not clean taps with scouring agents or other aggressive cleaners. A soft cloth moistened with warm water is usually completely sufficient. Solid stainless steel is usually the most resistant.
